name: Hyper Kidz Indoor Playground (Durham)
description: Colorful indoor play space with soft structures and LED floors. Safe for toddlers to climb, slide, and explore out of the weather.

name: Morehead Planetarium (Chapel Hill)
description: Historic planetarium with short, toddler-friendly shows and star exhibits. Great for a calm, educational indoor outing.

name: North Carolina Botanical Garden & Coker Arboretum (Chapel Hill)
description: Stroller-friendly garden paths with sensory plants and shaded nooks. Easy wandering and nature discovery for little ones.

name: Sarah P. Duke Gardens (Durham)
description: Beautiful landscaped gardens with shaded walks and water features. Plenty of space for toddlers to toddle and observe.

name: Eno River State Park
description: Easy trails with river views and picnic spots. Perfect for short nature adventures and splashy edge exploration.

name: Duke Forest
description: Flat, wide forest roads ideal for short family walks. Quiet paths with lots of birds, leaves, and sticks to discover.

name: Southern Village Green (Chapel Hill)
description: Open green space in the heart of Southern Village. Great for running around, meetups, and occasional family concerts.

name: Chapel Hill Community Center Park
description: Community park with playground, pool, and easy trails. Mix of indoor and outdoor options for flexible plans.

name: Hargraves Park & Playground (Chapel Hill)
description: Classic neighborhood playground with shade and picnic shelter. Simple, fun equipment for toddlers to climb and slide.

name: Homestead Aquatic Center (Chapel Hill)
description: Indoor pool that often offers toddler-friendly swim times. A good option for active play regardless of weather.

name: Durham Central Park + Farmers’ Market
description: Lively market with open lawns and occasional family activities. Toddlers can explore sights, sounds, and snacks.

name: Durham Museum of Life + Science
description: Large indoor/outdoor science museum with a train, butterfly house, and farmyard. Lots of hands-on areas suited for toddlers.

name: Piedmont Wildlife Center (Durham)
description: Trails and wildlife education programs in a wooded setting. Gentle hikes and nature encounters for curious kids.

name: Spring Haven Farm (Chapel Hill)
description: Seasonal farm visits with baby goats, tractors, and themed events. A fun, tactile outing for little animal lovers.

name: 1870 Farm (Chapel Hill)
description: Hands-on farm experience with pony rides and animal petting. Friendly staff and spaces designed for young children.

name: Maple View Farm Ice Cream (Hillsborough)
description: Local ice cream with sweeping farm views. Easy stop for a treat and a short stroll.

name: Tinkergarten Outdoor Classes
description: Guided outdoor classes focused on play-based learning. Parents join in as toddlers explore nature and simple activities.

name: My Little Farmer Programs (Durham/Chapel Hill)
description: Caregiver-and-me farm sessions with gentle animals and farm play. Structured yet relaxed activities geared to toddlers.

name: Library Storytimes (Orange/Durham Co.)
description: Free toddler storytimes with songs, simple crafts, and social time. A welcoming indoor option that’s easy to drop into.

name: Durham Bulls Baseball Games
description: Family-friendly minor league games with music, mascots, and snacks. Stadium energy keeps toddlers engaged between innings.

name: The Forest Theatre (Chapel Hill)
description: Stone amphitheater nestled in the woods with kid-friendly performances. Short walks and lots of steps to explore.

name: Northgate Park (Durham)
description: Neighborhood park with toddler playground, paved paths, and a duck pond. Shady and easy for quick play sessions.

name: Eastgate Park & Playground (Chapel Hill)
description: Fenced, toddler-friendly playground with simple equipment. A safe, contained spot for short outdoor play.
